programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and a pawnbroker toss a coin for a box of collectable scout badges.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley comes out from behind the security glass to confront a menacing customer, and there is more trouble when a man claims he has been robbed in the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley is in trouble with Seth and Les, who discover she is to blame for the shop's current cash crisis.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: The competition really hots up in the Crossfire Round and the Feast of Fire sees the chefs serving up the ultimate comfort food.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The explorers finally reach the bottom of borehole 10-X, while a whole new void is discovered deep in the Money Pit.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One hunter gives his deckhand more than he bargained for when he forgets his bullet clip, and another team goes in pursuit of a huge and terrifying gator.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's inexperienced brother has to take over from Colin on a job, a trailer has an accident on a blind corner and ends up badly damaged, and Brandon takes on a new role.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a 1972 telegram that prevents Muhammad Ali from fighting in Alaska, and a first edition copy of Oscar Wilde's The Happy Prince arrives in store.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1957 Harley-Davidson Sportster roars into the shop, and Rick takes a look at a painting of Vietnamese Communist leader Ho Chi Minh.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended version. Star Wars actress Carrie Fisher and comedians Bill Bailey and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies for a festive edition of the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks them a range of unusual questions on topics related to Christmas, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Janey Godley and barrister Robert Rinder joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Josh Widdicombe, choirboy-turned-presenter Aled Jones and DJ Sara Cox join Frank Skinner for the comedy panel show, competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Their gripes include Lord of the Rings, fish bones and death metal.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Lee Nelson, Stewart Francis and Paul Chowdhry
programme.desc: Cheeky Londoner Lee Nelson plays host for a 'well good' session of stand-up from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by Canadian funnyman Stewart Francis and observational comic Paul Chowdhry.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The stand-up comedian gets a job as a tattooist's apprentice, but discovers it could be the most painful job of all when he is told he will have to go under the needle himself.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Athletes take on daring stunts, with often hilarious results! Inspired by the sport of wakeboarding, Tim and Gendle invent a life-sized game of stone skipping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene eagerly anticipates Tyler's A-level results, dreaming of a long and distinguished academic future for her son. He is not as enamoured with the idea as she is, until Elgin, Jed, Bryan and Mrs Cakeworthy inadvertently paint a picture of the life he could have had. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie reluctantly signs up for Farm Idol, a new reality TV show aimed at finding Britain's sexiest rural workers, while Mrs Cakeworthy becomes suspicious of Marlene when a well-dressed man visits her while her husband is away. Comedy, starring John Challis and Sue Holderness.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called to the scene of a drive-by shooting, but the case proves less clear-cut than expected when evidence emerges that someone returned fire. The vehicle used is soon traced to an abandoned industrial unit, where a decomposing corpse is uncovered - and Nikki resolves to find out the true cause of death. Guest starring Craig Kelly and Freema Agyeman.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Piece of the Pie
programme.desc: Neil Manson returns to Sun Hill to work on the murder of a gay man and Phil Hunter spots a pattern in similar recent crimes. Lance Powell teams up with Laura Bryant to investigate a spate of robberies for which the local vicar turns out to be the chief suspect. Mark leaves his partner distraught when he moves out to find some space, and Cindy urges her reluctant husband to open the results of the paternity test.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy is charged with murder, and an accident in a college science laboratory leads to a horrific fire. Meanwhile, Carole gets her revenge on Davies.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A case of sexual assault puts Stacey in a difficult position and threatens to divide loyalties in the camp. Starring Kate O'Malley and Con O'Neill.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A Second World War bomb is discovered, which puts the wives at risk. Meanwhile, the clock begins to tick for Cate's unborn child.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Piece of the Pie
programme.desc: Neil Manson returns to Sun Hill to work on the murder of a gay man and Phil Hunter spots a pattern in similar recent crimes. Lance Powell teams up with Laura Bryant to investigate a spate of robberies for which the local vicar turns out to be the chief suspect. Mark leaves his partner distraught when he moves out to find some space, and Cindy urges her reluctant husband to open the results of the paternity test.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra tries to collect more HIV drugs from the pharmacist and performs an unnecessary operation on a patient, while Elliot reprimands Joseph again after catching him having a conversation with Martha. Sam tries to be supportive with Connie and asks to be her birthing partner, but she remains indifferent to his advances.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie is furious to discover Dan has involved a recovering Duffy in the major incident training exercise, and the pregnant nurse contemplates the future of her marriage. Meanwhile, a French exchange student collapses, and a widow takes a nasty fall. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Cathy Shipton, with a guest appearance by Margi Clarke.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Margi Clarke

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. An anonymous caller alerts Phil Hunter to common threads in recent murders, and the team starts looking for a serial killer on the Sun Hill gay scene. Lance Powell struggles to come to terms with Mark's decision to take time out from their relationship and decides to drown his sorrows, but a visit to the gay bar he recently investigated puts him in grave danger.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Carol's attempts to give Sonia a birthday she will remember go awry, Sanjay makes an enemy of Ian, and Pat is forced to face some home truths about life after Frank.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline's worried about Michelle and asks Mark to talk to her. Nigel finds out there's a thief about. Carol has problems with a criminal nearer home, and Phil fights with Jimmy.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch is called to a factory where a man has been crushed, while Carole's future is uncertain. Elsewhere, a resident complains about the siren noise from the station.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: An old friend of Will's requests his help to commit suicide in order to protect his family from the stigma associated with his illness - Aids. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Skelthwaite struggles to adjust to the loss of Sally Boothe, as husband Billy vows revenge for a rugby team's prank rather than face the reality of his wife's death. Anna and Kim welcome the latest recruit, excitable trainee Zoe Phelps, while the hospital staff attempt to make a young heart transplant patient's wish come true. Lesley Dunlop and Denise Van Outen star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon makes a go of it at the cafe, but Tracey finds it hard to feel pleased for her. Meanwhile, Dorien becomes preoccupied with more romantic pursuits. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey finds herself under suspicion after a valuable piece of DeVere's antique china mysteriously disappears while she helps him catalogue his collection. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy makes an ill-advised attempt to establish long-distance communication with Compo and Clegg by investing in some walkie-talkies. However, it doesn't take long for one of the units to fall foul of a tractor. Long-running rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy are intrigued by some perfectly respectable men who turn up without their trousers, before they take part in an event sponsored by a village charity.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A middle-class couple's adopted child is kidnapped, a case that takes Gently and Bacchus to a home where unmarried mothers are forced to give up their babies. Suspicion initially falls upon the natural mother, who is thought to have 'stolen' her baby back. But further investigations reveal a much darker side to the adoption home itself and raise questions as to how far this seemingly perfect couple were prepared to go to become parents. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Mark Gatiss, Helen Baxendale and Alison Steadman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ted leads an investigation into the apparent suicide of a city trader who was embroiled in the cut-throat world of London's financial district in the 1980s. As the team delve deeper into the macho fraternity of 'The Wolfpack', they find a darker side to the debauchery, secret hand signals and all-nighters that bonded the traders together - including a strict hierarchy that might be worth killing for. Meanwhile, Steve tries to learn some tricks of the trade, amid his own financial crisis. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team pursues a serial killer with a grisly desire to look at his victims' faces as they die, and the trail leads into the world of academic philosophy. However, Nikki is distracted from the case by the death of her grandmother, while Harry investigates the demise of a woman who apparently drowned in three inches of water.

programme.title: Ross Kemp Living With
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part special to begin the second series, the actor and film-maker examines the real-life impact of dementia. He meets Scott Mitchell, the husband of his former on-screen mum Barbara Windsor, who was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2014. Ross also travels to Leatherhead, Surrey, where he stays with Jerry Beckman, an actor, magician and keen sportsman who has early-onset dementia and Parkinson's disease.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Phil Vickery, husband of host Fern Britton, acts as judge as nine home cooks are whittled down in three intense culinary battles. Phil starts by demonstrating how tofinely puree garlic before contestants must attempt their own in just five minutes. Then six players are tasked to prepare a loin of venison from a rack, before the last three are given just two minutes to select from the larder containing an array of fresh fruit and vegetables, pulses and grains, condiments and sauce ingredients to pare with their prepared venison. A prize of 1,000 awaits the successful candidate.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV Live: Royal Ascot
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present behind-closed-doors-coverage of the second day of the festival, featuring the 3.00 Prince of Wales' Stakes and supporting races including the 2.25 King George V Handicap and 3.35 Royal Hunt Cup. With analysis from Jason Weaver, Kevin Blake and Johnny Murtagh, reports by Luke Harvey, Mick Fitzgerald and Matt Chapman, commentary by Richard Hoiles and social stable interaction from Oli Bell.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Geoff, Mary, Andy and Sheila pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While Nicola and Jimmy wind each other up in lockdown, she is seemingly busy with her local council business, but something is bothering her. Jimmy can't help but be aware of her sadness, but he's at a loss at what to do.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Newcomer Jordan tells Carla she had better pay up for the drugs she destroyed. Adam insists Daniel should go with him to a lawyers' drinks reception in town, and Roy returns from a meeting with Shona's key worker and confirms that David's confused ex will be moving in tomorrow.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: A special series looking back at Bradley and Barney's previous American adventures. As Bradley and Barney continue their road trip across America they arrive in Texas, where they experience space travel in a centrifuge, before heading to the outskirts of Houston to meet some UFO enthusiasts. Next up, the duo travel to New Orleans in Louisiana, where they meet a Voodoo High Priest for a spot of energy cleansing, before visiting the city's famous French Quarter.

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Tiger and Joey take a shine to new girl Amber, while Mateo is the odd choice to run a staff first-aid course. Eddie tries to make amends with Sheron after the near-drowning incident the day before, Kenneth could be in for a windfall after the death of his beloved Uncle Herbert, and Troy and Jacqueline come up with a plan to save the salon.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five family members from Northumberland answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.desc: The techniques used in the making of halogen bulbs, aluminium ladders, cellulose insulation and bamboo fly rods.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The techniques used in surfing deadly waves, and how the Arizona Cardinals' NFL stadium is transformed into a monster-truck venue in just 48 hours.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are in Yorkshire looking at a collection of Triumph motorcycles that are a bit out of their price range. However, something else may be of interest.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove visit a shop hoping to sell a bike and get side-tracked by the wares on offer. Will they manage to find some good bargains amongst all the delights?.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch

programme.desc: In West Yorkshire, locals watch as cooling towers are blown up. Plus, in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, a mansion is demolished and in Essex once-luxurious supercars are taken apart.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags an American classic, Chevrolet Corvette Stingray - but it has only been part-restored, so it is up to mechanic Edd China to complete the job.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars

programme.desc: Wayne Carini rescues a Jaguar 120 after a recluse's car-collecting becomes a hoarding habit.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A showdown between Saga and Seabrooke occurs. Captain Sig must make a tough decision, while the Time Bandit has a close call.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While Frank Fritz is on the mend. Mike Wolfe and his brother Robbie crisscross Colorado and find a giant cow-shaped RV.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours a Surrey sculpture park, where a pair of rare 18th-century church lych-gates catches his eye. In London, he visits a small showroom with big character.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In south Wales, a Rolls Royce 747 jet engine is deconstructed, in Bolton student halls are taken down and in Wakefield a sculptor creates a metal owl.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Volvo P1800 - but owing to a lack of available specimens, has trouble finding one that fits into his price range.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen confront a miner who has illegally dug their claim. The Young Guns must find a new source of opal when poisonous fumes force them to abandon their mine.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes on a trip to Jersey where he meets the island's biggest hoarder, and at an old manor house, he discovers an estate-made 1950s swing and trapeze.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore two teddy bears that share a love story, a Victorian lamppost on its last legs, and a toy car powered by steam.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Examining how the street lamps of Venice are cast, and how tiny trees are grown for the ancient Chinese art of penjing.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how one of the fastest bikes in the world was created, how pilots train to perform death-defying acrobatics, and how oil and gas is brought up from the bottom of the sea.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A seemingly charming and generous man who targets vulnerable women for his vicious attacks is tracked in a country-wide manhunt.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases unravelled by forensic examiners, including the discovery of a woman's decapitated body by a fisherman and a reported suicide involving a toxic liquid.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Pensacola Police investigate the disappearance of popular news reporter Sean Dugas, and find themselves drawn into an addictive world of gaming. Meanwhile, across state a mother vanishes after a family party and a neighbour's CCTV reveals a shocking tale of murder and betrayal.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The 1992 deaths of Tommy Griffin and his sister Connie Griffin Branham, both killed by shotgun wounds to the head. Gary Wayne Sutton and James Henderson - associates of Tommy Griffin - were convicted of the murders. Connie was killed a few days after her sibling while enquiring his whereabouts.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: An investigation into a US bank robbery in 1997, during which two armed men opened fire on staff and police officers at close range.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Stolen cattle are found abandoned beside a road, and officials investigate a case involving a Chihuahua that has been put into storage.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown feels the pressure when he comes to the aid of a distressed Sumatran tiger with a tooth problem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights her mother for control of the dress choice while a military bride argues over how her maids should look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Julianna wants a dress like one Pippa Middleton wore to the wedding of her sister the Duchess of Cambridge, but her opinionated friends have very different ideas in mind.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: War widow Rebecca has found love again but is unable to connect emotionally with a dress, so Flo and Robin hunt for the perfect gown to help her make a fresh start.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits have four hours to explore a market in Beziers. They then return to Cambridge and try to sell their upcycled finds for a profit..

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road in Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a tank, and one customer wants 10,000 for his gold - but can Dan help him reach his target? At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south-east London, boss Nathan Finch is bewitched by some valuable paintings, and wants to do a deal on some stunning earrings that could kick-start a dream business.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Houston SPCA officers rescue a seriously underweight young mare from cruelty.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators recall their work in the aftermath of Hurricane Rita, when the Houston SPCA launched one of the biggest animal rescue operations America has seen.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How a variety of unlikely objects, including beer bottles and insects, proved to be sources of vital evidence in murder investigations.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How crime writers research their material, combining the perspectives of police, criminals and journalists to provide detailed accounts of illegal activity.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of US Army veteran and mother-of-three Margaret Haddican-McEnroe, who disappeared from her New Jersey home in October 2006 leaving her five-month-old baby in its cot.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-four Amber Gerweck who went missing in April 2011. Her car was found in Georgia, 600 miles from her home, and when Amber eventually reappeared she claimed to have no recollection of events over the previous three weeks.

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The actress looks behind the headlines at the baffling mysteries, cold cases and compelling real-life dramas to uncover what really happened.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is racked with indecision, and a customer who wants to look like a 'classy porn star' is in for a surprise.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer and her picky entourage return to the shop for a second look, while a bride clashes with her mother over her choice of a non-traditional gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A dream dress turns into a nightmare, and a customer finally finds her perfect gown - only to realise it costs double her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A well-endowed customer finds her dress is going to cost more than expected, and another bride finds her mother does not approve of her risque dress ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride wants a feathered gown, to her parents' disapproval, while another customer likes every dress in the shop, while her relatives are less impressed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride cannot commit to a dress as her mother is too ill to come and approve it, while another customer desperately wants a gown that is over her budget.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US

programme.desc: A woman tries to lose enough weight to qualify for skin removal surgery, while a patient at a Beverly Hills clinic finds her treatment tougher than expected.

programme.desc: People considering surgery to remove excess skin following extreme weight loss.

programme.desc: Gok Wan helps Jade and her aunt Sadie rebuild their body confidence after battling cancer, setting out a radical agenda to get them loving themselves again.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Recounting how years after a successful TV producer was gunned down in his New York office, a tip led the FBI to a murderous entertainment industry giant.
